Comments_List: Good overview of the major visual media technologies used in Europe and N America from the Renaissance through the early 20th century
I gained exposure to the history of optical media
I learned about the history of various media technologies by reading texts and attending class lectures and discussions.

The course offers me a brand new understanding of media related to vision. It brilliant connects vision to the existential problems of humans, which are extremely interesting. I think I will look at any visual materials differently from now on

Strengths: 
- as above, a good overview of the major technologies and the historiographic debates surrounding them.
- I appreciated that the class didn't stick only to texts written by people who call themselves 'media archeologists' and instead took a broader and more historiographically sophisticated viewpoint. 

Weaknesses: 
- I feel the course could have benefitted from some introductory sessions in which we go more deeply into Foucault's archeological and genealogical methods, and discuss these in relation to some of the texts most commonly associated with "Media Archeology" as a field. Though, again, I felt that the syllabus took an approach to these topics that was ultimately more sophisticated than many current "archeological" approaches I feel many of us would have liked to leave the classroom able to speak with more authority (and critically) about the range of contemporary writing that goes under the name "media archeology" 
- Some examples, texts, etc. that are outside the European canon would be nice
I thought that the course was well organized and covered an interesting range of media and technologies

The readings were excellent and I appreciated the professors' presentations/overviews in class. I would have liked more time for student discussion, but this was difficult in the time frame. Perhaps the course should be slightly longer, or extend into the spring.
I thought that it was a fantastic class and would definitely recommend it
If the topic interests you, I recommend this course.
